articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's spy chief was to join his U.S. and Egyptian counterparts and Qatar's prime minister on Thursday for a new round of Gaza ceasefire talks in the Qatari capital Doha, officials briefed on the meeting said.
articles.title: Israel's spy chief due in Qatar for new round of Gaza ceasefire talks

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia began evacuating thousands more people from its border regions on Thursday after Ukraine said it was advancing deeper into the country in a lightning incursion aimed at forcing Moscow to slow its advance along the rest of the front.
articles.title: Russia evacuates thousands more people as Ukraine claims advances

articles.author: Panu Wongcha-Um
articles.description: The biggest party in Thailand's caretaker government will meet on Thursday to choose a successor for dismissed former premier Srettha Thavisin, as it races to shore up its alliance a day ahead of a pivotal parliamentary vote on a new prime minister.
articles.title: Thailand's Pheu Thai party to decide PM candidate as parliamentary vote looms

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Pavel Polityuk
articles.description: Ukraine has chalked up a string of victories more than a week since blindsiding Russia with a lightning cross-border assault, but the risks are piling up as its troops make plans to hold territory and Russia recovers its footing.
articles.title: Ukraine racks up gains with Russia incursion, faces challenge holding territory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ksenia Karelina, a Russian-American spa worker, was sentenced to 12 years in prison on Thursday by a Russian court after she was found guilty of treason for donating money to a charity supporting Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia sentences US-Russian citizen Karelina to 12 years in jail for treason

articles.author: Huseyin Hayatsever
articles.description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas on Thursday told Turkey's parliament he had decided to visit Gaza and Jerusalem to protest Israel's war on the enclave, adding that he saw no end to the conflict unless Israel withdrew from occupied Palestinian lands.
articles.title: Palestinian leader Abbas tells Turkish parliament he will visit Gaza, Jerusalem

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Steve Holland
articles.description: The U.S. so far deems Ukraine's surprise incursion into Russia's Kursk region a protective move appropriate for Kyiv to use U.S. equipment, officials in Washington said, but they expressed worries about potential complications as Ukrainian troops push further into enemy territory.
articles.title: Complications loom for US arms policy as Ukraine moves deeper into Russia

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine should negotiate an end to their conflict to avoid the war spilling over into Belarus, President Alexander Lukashenko, a key ally of Vladimir Putin, said in an interview with Russian state television.
articles.title: Belarus' Lukashenko urges Russia and Ukraine to end war as Kursk incursion continues

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sweden confirmed its first case of the viral infection mpox on Thursday, which was also the first case outside Africa, a day after the WHO declared the disease a global public health emergency for the second time in two years.
articles.title: Sweden confirms first case of mpox, also first outside Africa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said on Thursday he backed a new election in Venezuela.
articles.title: Biden says he supports new election in Venezuela
